div.p: Greetings. I thank you for those new things from France.

Hearing the mention of the Augsburg Confession, I will see to it that I act cautiously, so that the wretched do not seize upon it to disturb the matter. In the meantime, I acknowledge that nothing is done rashly or by chance.
May the Lord, in His eternal wisdom, direct everything to a good end. I have hastily written this letter, and because the messenger is in a hurry, I send it back to you.
There is nothing new with us now.
To the distinguished man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, the most sincere Antistes of the people of ZÃ¼rich, his most esteemed brother.
